p: Nutmeg EO is mostly constituted by monoterpenes (up to 90%) and phenylpropanoids. More than 30 components have been reported, with terpinen-4-ol, sabinene, and myristicin being the more abundant constituents of EO [ 13]. Phenylpropanoids such as eugenol, methyl eugenol, and methyl isoeugenol are also present in variable amounts, ranging from low to high percentages. For example, Morsyâ€™s study found a total amount of alkenyl benzenes equal to 21.34% [ 14], while Du and coworkers found a total amount equal to 59.00% [ 4].
